data.title: Christian, Crown Prince of Denmark
authors: Contributors to The World of Royalty Wiki
data.meta_description: Christian, Crown Prince of Denmark (Christian Valdemar Henri John; 15 October 2005) is the heir apparent to the Danish throne. Born during the reign of his paternal grandmother, Margrethe II, Christian is the eldest child of Frederik X and Queen Mary of Denmark. On 14 January 2024, he became...
data.text:
Christian, Crown Prince of Denmark (Christian Valdemar Henri John; 15 October 2005) is the heir apparent to the Danish throne. Born during the reign of his paternal grandmother, Margrethe II, Christian is the eldest child of Frederik X and Queen Mary of Denmark.

On 14 January 2024, he became Crown Prince of Denmark following his grandmother's abdication and his father's subsequent ascension to the throne.

Early Life[]

Birth[]

Main article: Birth of Prince Christian of Denmark

Christian was born at 1:57 on 15 October 2005 at Rigshospitalet in Copenhagen, Denmark. He was hospitalized briefly on 21 October due to neonatal jaundice. He was treated and discharged home the same day.

Christian has three younger siblings, Princess Isabella (2007), Prince Vincent (2011), and Princess Josephine (2011).

Christening[]

Main article: Christening of Prince Christian of Denmark

Christian was christened on 21 January 2006 at the chapel of Christiansborg Palace in Copenhagen. Per Danish tradition, his names were announced for the first time as Christian Valdemar Henri John.

Christian's godparents are Prince Joachim of Denmark, Haakon, Crown Prince of Norway, Mette-Marit, Crown Princess of Norway, Victoria, Crown Princess of Sweden, Pavlos, Crown Prince of Greece, Jane Stephens, Jeppe Handwerk, and Hamish Campbell.

Constitutional Position[]

On 11 September 2006, the Danish Minister for Foreign Affairs formally wrote and signed a hand-written document confirming Christian's place in the line of succession. Christian's full name, dates of birth and christening, and the names of his godparents were recorded as dictated by the Royal Law of 1799.

Education[]

On 27 March 2007, Christian became the first member of the royal family to attend nursery school.

On 12 August 2011, he started public school at Traneg√•rdskolen in Hellerup. He was also the first member of the royal family to attend a public state school.

Public Life[]

Christian Valdemar Viking[]

In 2006, Scandinavian Airlines named the first of their new A319 aircraft Christian Valdemar Viking in honor of Christian.

Activities[]

Titles, Styles, and Arms[]

15 October 2005 - 29 April 2008: His Royal Highness Prince Christian of Denmark

29 April 2008 - 14 January 2024: His Royal Highness Prince Christian of Denmark, Count of Monpezat

14 January 2024 - present: His Royal Highness The Crown Prince of Denmark, Count of Monpezat

Honors[]

References[]

Recipient of the Golden Jubilee Medal of Queen Margrethe II (14 January 2022)
